title: Malin Andersson bares all in nude snap as she celebrates her birthday with luxurious floral display
text:
Malin Andersson has shared a naked snap of herself as she celebrated her birthday with a luxurious floral display.

The former Love Island star, 27, took to Instagram to post the snap where she can be seen standing at a window in front of an exotic garden with her back turned to the camera.

Her raven locks styled into curls, Malin had her arms crossed in the snap with her head turned to the side, with several rose petals spelling out 'HBD Malin' with a love heart in the centre.

Beauty: Malin Andersson, 27, has shared a naked snap of herself as she celebrated her birthday with a luxurious floral display

Alongside the picture, Malin wrote: 'Happy Birthday to me'.

Some of the reality star's famous pals sent her their well wishes including TOWIE's Lauren Pope and Geordie Shore's Holly Hagan.

Malin recently shared a bikini snap of herself accompanied by a caption where she spoke about finding 'inner peace'.

She wrote: 'As I get older, I grow not just by age, but mentally and realise that as long as I have inner peace, I am happy.'

Raising awareness: It comes after the TV star shared a shocking picture of her heavily bruised arm in a bid to educate people about the dangers of domestic violence

It comes after the TV star shared a shocking picture of her heavily bruised arm in a bid to educate people about the dangers of domestic violence.

Malin added a lengthy caption: '⚠️ *TRIGGER WARNING* ⚠️ So I wanted to share this post with you all as it’s NATIONAL DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AWARENESS MONTH. It’s all a bit raw for me but I wanted to raise awareness for domestic abuse.

'I just want to post traits and warning signs so you can recognise them before it’s too late. I will open up fully and share my story once I come to terms with it all and I hope you understand.

'Domestic violence affects millions, both women and men, of every race, religion, culture and status. It’s not just punches and black eyes; it’s yelling, humiliation, stalking, manipulation, coercion, threats and isolation.

Happy: Malin recently shared a bikini snap of herself accompanied by a caption where she spoke about finding 'inner peace'

'It’s stealing a paycheck, keeping tabs online, non-stop texting, constant use of the silent treatment, or calling someone stupid so often they believe it.

Traits of a narcissist: Grandiosity, Lack of empathy, Emotionless, Self perception of being unique, Needing continual admiration, Sense of entitlement, Exploitative of others, Envious of others, Pompous and arrogant demeanour.

'Very good at acting. Now I will write about FEELINGS when involved in a narcassistic relationship - Feeling not good enough / lack of worth, Self-doubt and second guessing, Chronically apologetic - Confusion and as though you are losing your mind.

Details: Malin, who hasn't revealed who caused the injury to her arm, listed a number of traits and warning signs for her followers to raise aware for National Domestic Violence month

'Helplessness and hopelessness - Sadness and depression - Feelings of anxiousness, shame, worry, - Unsettled, Mental and emotional exhaustion.'

Malin went on to add further guidance for those affected, adding: 'Women’s aid hotline - 0808 2000 247

'I also recommend the FREEDOM COURSE which has helped me massively. ‘ONCE YOU CHOOSE HOPE, ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE.’

Malin has had a difficult year, beginning with the sad passing of her newborn daughter Consy in January, aged just four weeks, following a premature birth.

'Will open up fully once I come to terms with it': The former Love Island star admitted that her experience with domestic violence was 'still a bit raw for her'

Consy, who she shares with now ex Tom Kemp, was born on December 23 by emergency Caesarean nearly two months early after a heart defect was detected at 33 weeks.

She was sadly too small, weighing in at 4lb 8oz to be operated on.

Malin is battling her way through her grief in an incredibly positive fashion, but it's fair to say she has had a tough time in recent years.

Heartbreak: Malin has had a difficult year, beginning with the sad passing of her newborn daughter Consy in January, aged just four weeks, following a premature birth

She lost her mother, also called Consy, back in 2017 following a battle with cancer and she has also lost her father to cancer when she was just a year old.

Malin told The Sun just ten weeks after losing her daughter that she is trying her best to be positive.

She said: 'It would be easy to feel angry. I step outside and see lots of babies and I could look at them and think: "Why isn’t my girl here?"

'Or I could think: "What a beautiful baby." It’s the only way I can survive, otherwise depression will swallow me up. I’ll end up suicidal.

'I’ve just got this resilience. It’s been built into me that no one is around for long, and I guess with baby Consy I prepared for the worst.'

For confidential support call the Women’s Aid Domestic Violence Helpline on 0808 2000 247. See womensaid.org.uk.
description: The former Love Island star, 27, took to Instagram to post the snap where she can be seen standing at a window in front of an exotic garden with her back turned to the camera.
